text: <@U1TA5FDU7> Sure thing - I'm more after the reasoning behind it's setup rather than advice on how to use it though, I agree it's difficult to use which makes me wonder why it was designed that way
I used the postman to deploy 2 chaincodes (chaincode_example02 & chaincode_example01) to a blockchain network with 4 peers. And after deploying, I got more 8 containers. Why did peer do that?
<@U2RMVHMK9|hiepnm> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/hiepnm/F2WN3Q9DE/-.txt|Untitled>

text: <@U2RMVHMK9> each peer runs it's own copy of each deployed chaincode in a separate Docker container. You have 4 peers and 2 deployed chaincodes so you get 4 * 2 chaincode containers.
<@U1MSZ37NK> 1st chaincode I set A=100 (WorldState), 2nd chaincode I set A = 200. How many is A value I get?
<@U1MSZ37NK> Thank you very much.

I have a "4 peers" blockchain network with pbft consensus (vp0, vp1, vp2, vp3). I used postman (to generate post REST API) to deploy a chaincode (chaincode_example02, A=100, B=200) in to this network, and get more 4 containers that run my chaincode.
I call Invoked transaction to vp0 to get the result like this (A-5, B+5 => A=95, B=205).
Then, I requested QUERY to vp3 to get A value. I got A=95. It's OK.
And then, I stop peer vp3, and restart it. After that, I call query request to vp3 to get A value. But, I got A=100 (like after chaincode deploy).
Why did I get A=100 instead of 95?
World state is partitioned by chaincode ID, so the 1st and 2nd chaincodes see different 'A's
<@U1MSZ37NK> thank you. I have more statement like above. Can you help me?
I don't know the answer to the vp3 restart problem I'm afraid. Put the questions in the Slack?
<@U1MSZ37NK> thank you
<@U1TA5FDU7> and all: I'm looking forward to see your answers.
<@U2RMVHMK9> The fabric network can not support dynamic join, I vaguely remembered a developer said that before. Also, i think when you restart the vp3, maybe your specify the wrong container id.
<@U1TA5FDU7> thank you. I restarted vp3, with the correct ID. When I stopped vp3 container, the chaincode container attached with vp3 also stopped.
<@U1MSZ37NK> <@U1TA5FDU7> I have just replayed with my problem. It has returned right (A=95 on vp3). I don't know the reason. :disappointed:
How do I get all transactions in my ledger? And I want to get information (world state,....) of a transaction in history. What can I do?
<@U2RMVHMK9> you can query the state if you know the key… as for seeing the transactions, you can use the blockchain-explorer to visualize what is in there
there is no way to retrieve the entire contents of the ledger
